units.title: snRNA-seq on adult cortex
units.text: a, snRNA-seq was performed on sliced tissue cubes dissected from adult human, chimpanzee or bonobo, and macaque frozen prefrontal cortex tissue.
units.rationale: Specifies the snRNA-seq procedure on adult brain samples.

units.title: Linking peaks to nearby genes
units.text: a differentially accessible peak was linked to the nearest expressed gene within 1 Mb of that gene’s transcription start site.
units.rationale: Details how peaks were associated with genes.

units.title: Detection of differentially accessible peaks
units.text: e, Differentially accessible (DA) peaks detected humans overlapping differentially accessible peaks and non-differentially between human and chimpanzee NPCs and neurons.
units.rationale: Outlines the identification of DA peaks across species.

units.title: Peak enrichment analysis
units.text: f, Enrichment of accessible peaks (randomly sampled 2,000 times to match the number and selected biological-process gene ontology (GO) terms associated with average accessibility of differentially accessible peaks).
units.rationale: Describes the statistical enrichment test for peaks.

units.title: t-SNE visualization of chromatin accessibility
units.text: c, ChromVAR29-based t-stochastic neighbour embedding (t-SNE) of human (left, 518 cells) and chimpanzee (right, 908 cells) with cells coloured by time point or cell state.
units.rationale: Provides the method for visualizing cell clusters.

units.title: Classification of peak genomic locations
